p.seg: In fact, these "heroes" were all about seeking fame, that's what they were! WSM: 。好名，指桀、紂而言。
isn't that acceptable? GX takes this differently: 『正其形而虛其心，言遜而不二。』 WXM: 。端與勉，是存有待之心，尙未通達。

Being full of assertiveness (Yang) and and then making a show of "empty" receptiveness, GX makes it clear that the reference is to ruler of Wèy: 『言衛君康陽之性充張於內，而甚揚於外。」WSM takes 夫 as a pronoun which is grammatically tempting since there otherwise is no subject after 夫: 夫猶彼也。

Listening is limited to the (sound range of) the ear, 俞樾：：『「聽止於耳 ，」當作「耳止於聽。」傳寫誤倒也，乃申說「無聽之以耳」之義。言耳之爲用，止於聽而已 ，故「無聽之以耳」也。WSM agrees on the grounds that Cheng Xuanying's subcommentary apprears to support Yu Yue's emendation:成疏『不著聲塵，止於聽。』是所據 正文本作『耳止於聽。」今本作「聽止於耳。」聽、耳二字互誤也。
